results.secPara: Todays gossip leans precariously on Big Jack
results.webTitle: Football transfer rumours: Danny Rose and Kyle Walker to Manchester United?

results.firPara: • Brazilian set to be in squad for EFL Cup semi-final first leg at Southampton
results.secPara: Jürgen Klopp underlined Philippe Coutinhos importance to Liverpool when he said brief appearances by the Brazilian could be decisive at Southampton and Manchester United this week.
results.webTitle: Philippe Coutinho cameos may be vital for Liverpool’s chances, says Klopp

results.firPara: You might have expected the Cambridge United manager, Shaun Derry, to be pleased that his side gave Leeds United, a team two divisions above his own, a significant scare in their FA Cup third round tie on Monday. Not a bit of it. Ive got disappointment seeping through my blood, said Derry, after Leeds came from a goal down to seal victory at the Cambs Glass Stadium.
results.secPara: Derrys disappointment stemmed from an eight-minute second half spell in which Leeds scored two virtually identical goals, through Stuart Dallas and Alex Mowatt, when Cambridge had dominated the first half and could have added to Uche Ikpeazus opener. Yes, we can walk out with our heads held high in many respects, but Im disappointed we didnt come in 2-0 up at half-time, said Derry, a man clearly not satisfied with moral victories.
results.webTitle: Leeds United’s Alex Mowatt proves too bright for Cambridge in FA Cup

results.firPara: The controversy surrounding Millwalls stadium has taken another significant turn with the news that three local Conservative associations have written to the secretary of state for local government, Sajid Javid, and the mayor of London, Sadiq Khan, urging both men to step in and review the entire development.
results.secPara: Lewisham councils compulsory purchase order of land around the Den is due to be heard on Wednesday night. With reservations on all sides of the political divide about the scheme which would see the land being given to a developer with historic links to the Labour council, Lewishams three Conservative associations have urged the government to act on a scheme described as fraught with problems from the start.
results.webTitle: Clamour grows to review Millwall scheme as Sadiq Khan urged to step in

results.firPara: The president of the Nigerian Football Federation, Amaju Pinnick, has said it would be a big surprise if Gianni Infantinos proposals to expand the World Cup to 48 teams from 2026 are not enthusiastically adopted when the Fifa Council meets in Zurich on Tuesday.
results.secPara: Pinnick is in Switzerland and, while he is not one of the 37 members of the council, he said he has yet to meet anyone who does not support the Fifa presidents plan.
results.webTitle: Gianni Infantino’s 48-team World Cup plan set to be approved by Fifa

results.firPara: Carli Lloyd of the United States has won her second straight Fifas best woman player award.
results.secPara: Lloyd, who finished with 20.68% of the total votes, beat Olympic gold medalist Melanie Behringer of Germany (16.60%) and five-times winner Marta of Brazil (12.34%).
results.webTitle: USA's Carli Lloyd wins second straight Fifa best player award

results.firPara: Manchester Uniteds FA Cup defence and bid for a record 13th triumph will continue in a fourth-round tie against Wigan Athletic, the 2013 winners, at Old Trafford.
results.secPara: José Mourinho, a winner with Chelsea against United in 2007, has revived his new team after an indifferent start and will look favourably on a draw against the Championship club.
results.webTitle: FA Cup fourth-round draw: Southampton or Norwich v Arsenal, Manchester United v Wigan

results.firPara: Manchester United will host Wigan, Sutton will face Cambridge or Leeds if they get past AFC Wimbledon and Lincoln will host Brighton if they see off Ipswich
results.secPara: Well that was a bore draw if ever I saw one. The tie of the round? Youre guess is as good as mine. Tottenham v Wycombe and Chelsea v Brentford would both have been more interesting if the Premier League sides had been drawn away, and there is a chance that Bolton could host Manchester City and Norwich may welcome Arsenal, but replays could scupper those clashes. Ill leave you with this thought from David in Bristol
results.webTitle: FA Cup fourth-round draw: Tottenham v Wycombe, Chelsea v Brentford, Derby v Leicester

results.firPara: In todays Fiver the magic of the Cup (part 376), Diego Maradonas stellar judgment and the good ship Do Ones roaring trade
results.secPara: In todays Fiver the magic of the Cup (part 376), Diego Maradonas stellar judgment and the good ship Do Ones roaring trade
results.webTitle: Stringing tinsel around a broom handle

results.firPara: We had it in our hands, Bruno Soriano said at the end of his teams 1‑1 draw with Barcelona on Sunday, to which the most appropriate response, as it so often is with Villarreals captain, as it had been virtually all game, was probably well played, sir. Hed delivered his line deadpan, like he delivers his passes, as if it didnt matter but it did calm, controlled, and accurate. You almost expected a wink but all you got was a smile, a glimmer of cheek, and that was coaxed from him.
results.secPara: It had been in their hands, all right; his, particularly. The night the Madrigal became the Estadio de la Cerámica; the Ceramic Stadium. Villarreal led from the 50th minute, heading for a first home win over Barcelona in 11 years, but an 89th-minute Leo Messi free kick prevented them marking the occasion with victory and maintaining their spot in the Champions League places.
results.webTitle: Gerard Piqué points finger as Villarreal push title out of Barcelona’s hands
